meanings.definition: A section of the Earth's oceanic crust and the underlying upper mantle that has been uplifted and exposed above sea level.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study ophiolites to learn about the oceanic crust.
meanings.sent2: The ophiolites in this region provide valuable insights into Earth's history.
meanings.sent3: The ophiolites decided to take a break from being under the sea and see the world above.
meanings.sent4: The ophiolites rising above the land were like a hidden treasure unearthed by nature.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the ophiolites jutting out of the ground was a stunning reminder of the planet's hidden layers.

meanings.definition: A type of rock formation composed of oceanic crust and mantle material that has been obducted onto continental crust.
meanings.sent1: The unique composition of ophiolites sets them apart from other rocks.
meanings.sent2: Geologists use ophiolites to understand the complex processes of plate tectonics.
meanings.sent3: The ophiolites rolling onto the continental crust were quite the unexpected guests.
meanings.sent4: The ophiolites on the land seemed like pieces of the ocean misplaced by nature.
meanings.sent5: The colors and textures of the ophiolites made them stand out like jewels in the earth's crown.
